description:
*n* friends stand in a circle. For each friend his height a[i] is known. Two friends can be made to stand beside each other to minimize the height difference,  i.e. *|ai - aj|* is minimal. So each of them will be less noticeable with the other. Output the minimal difference possible between two friends.
### Input
```
The first line contains integer n (2 ≤ n ≤ 100) — amount of friends. Then follow the heights of the friends in their order in the circle — n space-separated integers a1, a2, ..., an (1 ≤ ai ≤ 1000). The friend heights are given in clockwise direction.
```

### Output
```
Output the minimal difference possible between two friends.
```
### Sample Input
```
5
10 12 13 15 10
```
### Sample Output
```
0
```
### Explanation
```
The input represents the heights of friends:
10 12 13 15 10
After sorting the array in ascending order, we get:
10 10 12 13 15
Now, we find the pair of neighboring friends with the minimum absolute height difference. In this case, the minimum difference is 0 which is between the two firends with same height 10 and 10.
```
title: Minimum height difference
